column1: Little Goat Diner////With a James Beard award and Top Chef plus Iron Chef titles to her name
column2: Stephanie Izard has already entered the pantheon of Chicago culinary royalty. Little Goat is the dressed-down
column3: diner version of her flagship enterprise
column5: with a more globally inspired twist. To be quite honest
column6: I have visited GatG somewhere between 2-4 times (though it has been a few years) and I always found the fare to be on the salty side. Their whole goat leg IS shockingly tasty however. I actually favor Duck Duck Goat
column8: as the superior restaurant. These were the thoughts percolating in my mind as I sat down for brunch at Little Goat
column9: specifically on their covered and enclosed street-side patio.
